intro: Laseguea guilleminiana, commonly known as the Guillemin's larkspur, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its foliage consists of palmately compound leaves with serrated edges, and it produces small, follicle-like fruits. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
